page.title: 19THE GREEN LADY.
page.content: After the battle of Sedgmoor a Monmouth supporter on the run was hidden in a grotto in the grounds of Woodrow High House by his fiancee Lady Helena Stanhope,ward of the owner Sir Peter Bostock.A maid saw her taking food to him,and told the troops in Amersham.The next time Lady Helena took food to him she found her lover had been discovered and killed. Broken hearted,she returned to the house and poisoned herself.Many people have seen her ghost walking down the stairs, passing through a window (which used to be the front door)and visiting the grotto.She then returns to the house weeping,and then drinks from a bottle from a cupboard in the Cromwell room. There is a large portrait of her in a green dress in the house,and,where- ever you sit in the room, the eyes seem to follow you..........
